replies.text:
And even the petite bourgeois hate banks because they don't want to have to pay interest. It's inter capitalist conflict and a battle for surplus. Nationalist turns are not proletarian

11th July 1949

‚ÄúYou speak of Sinified socialism. There is nothing of the sort in nature. There is no Russian, English, French, German, Italian socialism, as much as there is no Chinese socialism. There is only one Marxist-Leninist socialism. It is another thing, that in the building of socialism it is necessary to take into consideration the specific features of a particular country. Socialism is a science, necessarily having, like all science, certain general laws, and one just needs to ignore them and the building of socialism is destined to failure...

If you understand this everything with the building of socialism in China will be fine. If you won‚Äôt you will do great harm to the international communist movement. As far as I know in the CPC there is a thin layer of the proletariat and the nationalist sentiments are very strong and if you will not conduct genuinely Marxist-Leninist class policies and not conduct struggle against bourgeois nationalism, the nationalists will strangle you. Then not only will socialist construction be terminated, China may become a dangerous toy in the hands of American imperialists. In the building of socialism in China I strongly recommend you to fully utilise Lenin‚Äôs splendid work ‚ÄòThe Immediate Tasks of Soviet Power‚Äô. This would assure success.‚Äù

‚Äî ¬†J.V. Stalin,

Thank you, and happy to know you as neighbors at least.

author: @jaredsalin7922
text: I love you Eddie and anyone promoting marxism or ecosocialism, but honestly its mad depressing that you only get 290 likes... I want to practice hope, I want to be hopeful for our collective future. How do you practice hope despite seemingly unsurmountable opposition to our ideals? America is so uniquely anti-communist because of its history of human domination and exploitation, wherein our ruling class of slaveowners and monopoly owners have pushed the public narrative as opposed to the groups actually doing the work that pushes this country forward. I do feel the time in era of time to build socialist movements and workers' unions, but if feels like, for me personally, being too vocal or visible about these ideas gets me shunned, fired from work (I have been too many times... possibly b/c my hammer&sickle tattoo on the tricep ticks off the boss, maybe personality of being a rebellious spirit with enough education to develop communist ideas does me in). What do you see for our future? As in Ideal future... I can already imagine the dystopian part, what do you see for how the social movement takes root.. I am probably more isolated than I want to be, I wish to be more involved.. Even so, many of my circle agree with communist/socialist rhetoric, but we can't actually elect a socialist, can we? What should I do? blow up oil pipelines? Chain up the entrances to JP morgan? Post on Social Media with enticing communist content/education? Or just pray more and hope we all make it to the greener grass future without billionaires and war. Much Love, your tiktoks radicalized me in 2020, I absolutely hope  you can influence more and be a part of a better American, and consequently, world future.

author: @comradehogan7636
text:
11th July 1949

‚ÄúYou speak of Sinified socialism. There is nothing of the sort in nature. There is no Russian, English, French, German, Italian socialism, as much as there is no Chinese socialism. There is only one Marxist-Leninist socialism. It is another thing, that in the building of socialism it is necessary to take into consideration the specific features of a particular country. Socialism is a science, necessarily having, like all science, certain general laws, and one just needs to ignore them and the building of socialism is destined to failure.

What are these general laws of building of socialism.

1. Above all it is the dictatorship of the proletariat the workers‚Äô and peasants‚Äô State, a particular form of the union of these classes under the obligatory leadership of the most revolutionary class in history the class of workers. Only this class is capable of building socialism and suppressing the resistance of the exploiters and petty bourgeoisie.

2. Socialised property of the main instruments and means of production. Expropriation of all the large factories and their management by the state.

3. Nationalisation of all capitalist banks, the merging of all of them into a single state bank and strict regulation of its functioning by the state.

4. The scientific and planned conduct of the national economy from a single centre. Obligatory use of the following principle in the building of socialism: from each according to his capacity, to each according to his work, distribution of the material good depending upon the quality and quantity of the work of each person.

5. Obligatory domination of Marxist-Leninist ideology.

6. Creation of armed forces that would allow the defence of the accomplishments of the revolution and always remember that any revolution is worth anything only if it is capable of defending itself.

7. Ruthless armed suppression of counter revolutionaries and the foreign agents.

These, in short, are the main laws of socialism as a science, requiring that we relate to them as such. If you understand this everything with the building of socialism in China will be fine. If you won‚Äôt you will do great harm to the international communist movement. As far as I know in the CPC there is a thin layer of the proletariat and the nationalist sentiments are very strong and if you will not conduct genuinely Marxist-Leninist class policies and not conduct struggle against bourgeois nationalism, the nationalists will strangle you. Then not only will socialist construction be terminated, China may become a dangerous toy in the hands of American imperialists. In the building of socialism in China I strongly recommend you to fully utilise Lenin‚Äôs splendid work ‚ÄòThe Immediate Tasks of Soviet Power‚Äô. This would assure success.‚Äù

‚Äî ¬†J.V. Stalin,

replies.author: @SEARCHandRESEARCH
replies.text: I would suggest reading 'Marxism and The National Question'.  Part of what defines a nation is its shared history and the unique culture(s) it manifests over time (good and bad).  The hundreds of years since the settlers' arrival has produced a nation with its own unique identity, (that includes the cultures & histories of the Native Americans).   The numerous victories that the colonizers experienced, followed by the victories of the capitalists , has resulted in an imperialist state.  A state so captured by capital through and through that there is no practical path of bringing lasting justice to the indigenous people, or any oppressed minority,  other than the path that will bring justice to all of the people. This doesn't deny the heinous crimes our ancestors committed, nor the disproportionate suffering that the indigenous people still suffer because of those crimes. On the contrary, it's caring enough to be pragmatic about a solution, which is a critical mass of class consciousness  and the revolution that'll follow. MLK, DuBois, Fred Hampton, and many others knew this. We should listen to them,  rather than be led by the likes of Bezos and Soros towards impractical pathos and virtue signaling that only further strengthens their ruling class.

Expecting the mass of the population to think of themselves as settlers isn't realistic@thamsanqandlovu4037

There‚Äôs nothing concrete about how we wage class struggle under the current conditions. It‚Äôs all about imposing a guilt tax on the majority of the population. Every single white person must ‚Äòacknowledge‚Äô their ancestral sin before we can start the class struggle. And since that isn‚Äôt going to happen, the class struggle can never begin. Needless to say, bourgeois academia and the ruling class love this stuff

author: @christianjarvis167
text:
I agree that the "settler-colonial" ideology boils down to a perpetuation of race war, however scientifically speaking, on a concrete level, the working class has no country, and as long as we lean into nationalist ideology, even if it is dressed in a red flag, nationalism will foment social chauvinism, it's simply too easy for it to be used by opportunists. This is a debate whose answer was found by the response of the second international to the outbreak of ww1. Patriotism brought some of the most fervent marxists like Kautsky, Plekhanov etc to support their own national identities "against" imperialism. 

It is not different, and there is no magical difference about Americans that serves to alter their class consciousness to such a degree that they require marxism to be babied up to be more palatable for them through the veneer of patriotism. The national market is synonymous with the national state, and the function of socialism is to bring the economic capacity of the worker's state beyond what is possible in a single state, that is where socialism BEGINS.

replies.author: @stevedbertram
replies.text: Can you point to a single example of revolution that isn't based in nationalism?

replies.author: @christianjarvis167
replies.text: @stevedbertram¬† bruh the USSR required internationalism for it to have any chance at success at all, Russia was a prison house of nations, russian nationalism would have sabotaged the revolution, and the later nationalism that developed completely sabotaged the co-operation that could have existed with China. If it doesn't tend toward borders dissolving it isn't worker's democracy.

author: @Six_slotted
text:
Eddie I appreciate you're trying to be diplomatic but its actually crucial that you attack land back not just for incidental failures such as co-option by specific capitalists but on a much more fundamental level

From Marx's analysis we know that:
a) the proletariat only exists as class in relation to capital. Labor is literally the antagonistic pole to capital
b) therefore the only condition in which the proletariat can be meaningfully liberated is its abolition. It cannot be free if it exists

Therefore any political demand that reaffirms the existence of proletariat directly or indirectly via the reaffirmation of capital fundamentally is not revolutionary

And by that standard landback is fundamentally reactionary given that it reaffirms property, property being one of the relations of production inherent in capitalism

Actual communists such as myself will back you up when leftists attack you for their class collaborationism and ethno-nationalism with revolutionary aesthetics

author: @bengallup9321
text:
I may be misunderstanding the argument, but I disagree with a couple things here as they are presented. 

Firstly, the fact that the US, Canada, Australia etc. are settler colonial societies IS an important thing for communists to recognize. That does not mean people should feel guilty, but it is very important context that remains relevant today due to things like historical dispossession and intergenerational trauma, as is the legacy of slavery. I think the main goals of this movement align very well with addressing this legacy, so I do not see it as an "either or" scenario as it is presented here. 

Second, "land back" is not a call for a race war, that is kind of a ridiculous straw man. To most Indigenous groups of Canada and the USA, land was fundamentally something that was not owned for private property nor for profit, and was in stead to be used communally for the benefit of everyone... sound familiar? I think that there is a great opportunity to have Indigenous views on land stewardship and communal use augment the Marxist analysis, rather than detract from it.

replies.author: @antediluvianatheist5262
replies.text: Land Back specifically is a liberal movement to privatise public lands by giving them to private native individuals, and encouraging them to sell or lease it to others.

replies.author: @itscolin81
replies.text: @Nom_D_Guerre My argument is plainly stated above. If you wanted to argue it intelligently, you would have.

replies.author: @Nom_D_Guerre
replies.text: Got it, so it's a crap argument, and you're just slandering.  Cool, have a great day, dingus.

replies.author: @itscolin81
replies.text: @Nom_D_Guerre Proving my point.

replies.author: @itscolin81
replies.text:
@Nom_D_Guerre Here, I'll distill it down so even a patsoc can comprehend.

"t's the same for all of us no matter um
what color we are "

Rates of poverty, incarceration and several other ills of capitalism vary according to "um what color we are." 

Even the specific examples given, deindustrialization and debt trapping disproportionately impact people according to "um what color they are."

Get it?

Constructing an effective political line to overcome the racist character of US class structure would be to advocate for OVERCOMING racial divides and to strive for unity - not framing this reality as too far in the past to matter or that we are "um duh um duhhh all the same."

replies.author: @antediluvianatheist5262
replies.text:
@itscolin81 No, you were asked to state your position clearly and unambiguously.
You refused.
You left it to others to interpret what you meant.
You are being evasive.

replies.author: @itscolin81
replies.text: @antediluvianatheist5262 even rates of deindustrialization and debt trapping aren't "all the same"... Eddie's own examples.

author: @jessewallace12able
text: I always get a kick out of communists that are not blue collar workers.

replies.author: @p.a.marlow9348
replies.text: The communist movement is open to anyone who is not part of the bourgeoisie.

author: @chrachrochris
text: How is it controversial? Aside from being overtly communist. Genuinely asking!

replies.author: @antediluvianatheist5262
replies.text:
American exceptionalism. 
Everyone from Lenin to Mao all emphasised the role of and need for patriotism. Some like Mao and Kim and Ho specifically exhorted Americans to be patriotic for a better America.
but because of American exceptionalism, the defeatist 'communists' with too much liberal/anarchist baggage don't think that it applies to them, because America is exceptionally bad.
As if building an org to overthrow a corrupt government on behalf of the people was anything BUT patriotic.

replies.author: @chrachrochris
replies.text: @antediluvianatheist5262 fair. The term patriotic has been co-opted then‚Ä¶not sure how helpful it is to those on the soc/comm left to use it
